title.native: きらりん☆レボリューション

description:
Kirari Tsukishima, a gluttonous 14-year-old beauty, is a girl who does not care about idols and the entertainment world because her mind is occupied by food. Her obsession with food only causes her to be clueless about love.

One day, after saving a turtle that is stranded in a tree, Kirari meets with a handsome and gentle boy named Seiji, who gives her ticket to a SHIPS (a popular idol group) concert to show his gratitude for her saving his pet. Kirari then storms off to the concert and runs into another boy, who tears up her ticket and warns her to stay away from Seiji because she and Seiji live in different worlds. The outraged Kirari then sneaks into the concert, only to discover that Seiji and the boy who tore her ticket, named Hiroto, are actually members of SHIPS.

Finally understanding the meaning of "different worlds" (Seiji is a popular idol while she is an average middle school student), Kirari refuses to give up. Filled with determination to be with Seiji, she declares that she will also become an idol.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

A close personal friend of [Kozue Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/96937/Kozue-Amano). She was invited on stage to Anime Festival Asia 2011.

In 2013, she married a man from outside the anime industry.

__Non anime roles:__
- Azami - Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (VG)
- Dorothy - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Jean](https://anilist.co/character/190865/Jean-Gunnhildr) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- [Kotori Kanbe](https://anilist.co/character/37486/) - Rewrite (VG)
- Mayer - Arknights (VG)
- [Wakamo Kosaka](https://anilist.co/character/287031/) - Blue Archive (VG)
- Changli - Wuthering Waves (VG)
- Castorice - Honkai Star Rail (VG)
- Metis - Persona 3 Reload : Episode Aigis -The Answer (VG)

__Height:__ 162 cm (5'3.8")   
__Member Color:__ Red (formerly grey)

Kusumi Koharu (久住小春) was the only seventh generation member of [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/) and was also a soloist within Hello! Project. She graduated from Morning Musume and Hello! Project on December 6th 2009.

__Height:__ 162 cm (5'3.8")   
__Member Color:__ Red (formerly grey)

Kusumi Koharu (久住小春) was the only seventh generation member of [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/) and was also a soloist within Hello! Project. She graduated from Morning Musume and Hello! Project on December 6th 2009.

℃-ute was an female Japanese pop group within Hello! Project. The character "℃" (degree Celsius) is substituted for "C" in notation for the purpose of expressing ardor—the hyphen does not have any meaning in particular. The proper pronunciation for this group in Japanese is kyūto (キュート) with pitch accents on both "ū" and "o." They have sold over 718,946, copies in Japan alone. They are the 2008 sponsers for the Touhuku Rakuten Eagels. On August 20, 2016, it was announced that ℃-ute would disband following a final live concert at Saitama Super Arena on June 12, 2017.

Current Members:
• Yajima Maimi (leader)
• Nakajima Saki
• [Suzuki Airi](https://anilist.co/staff/165660/)
• Okai Chisato
• [Hagiwara Mai](https://anilist.co/staff/101091/)

Former Members:
• Umeda Erika
• Murakami Megumi
• Arihara Kanna

MilkyWay is a Hello! Project trio consisting of Ex-Ceed member and soloist Koharu Kusumi and Hello Pro Egg members Sayaka Kitahara and Yuu Kikkawa. The unit was made mainly for the anime Kirarin Revolution as all girls lend voices to characters in the series.   (Source: Wikipedia)

__[Website](http://www.tsunku.net/)__

__Birthplace:__ Higashiosaka City, Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kinki University (Faculty of Commerce)

__Introduction:__
Mitsuo Terada, alternatively known by stage name Tsunku, is a prolific Japanese record producer, songwriter, and vocalist.

__Biography:__
He is best known for having two major roles in the Japanese music landscape: first as the lead singer of the popular rock group Sharam Q, and now as the producer, primary composer, lyricist, and (until 2014) primary studio backing vocalist for highly popular idol group [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/), in addition to Aya Matsuura and other associated idols under the Hello! Project banner, for whom he has written and produced the vast majority of their chart-topping hits. 

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsunku))

__[Website](http://www.tsunku.net/)__

**Bruno Méyère** is a French voice actor and director for anime.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- A.J. in "Gutterballs" (French)
- Campbell in "Burn Notice" (French)
- Geek in "Astropia" (French)
- K.C. Guthrie in "Degrassi Next Generation" (French)
- Michelangelo in "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 2012" (French)!~
He is famous for the roles of Muten Roushi in Dragon Ball and for being the narrator of a good deal of Anime like: Dragon Ball, One Piece, Naruto, and Saint Seiya.
